definitions: To place something over or in front of (something else) in order to protect, conceal, or close it.
To deal with (a subject) by describing or analyzing it.
To provide enough money to pay for something.
examples: She covers the baby with a blanket.
The report covers various aspects of the economy.
He covers about fifty miles a day on his bike.
The insurance covers the cost of repairs.
The job covers a wide range of responsibilities.
